creator: Rebecca Bellan
title: (No AI) OpenAI reportedly finalizing $100B deal at more than $850B valuation
dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
content: OpenAI is reportedly getting close to closing a $100 billion deal, with backers including Amazon, Nvidia, SoftBank, and Microsoft. The deal would value the ChatGPT-maker at $850 billion.
contentSnippet: OpenAI is reportedly getting close to closing a $100 billion deal, with backers including Amazon, Nvidia, SoftBank, and Microsoft. The deal would value the ChatGPT-maker at $850 billion.

creator: Jagmeet Singh
title: (No AI) OpenAI, Reliance partner to add AI search to JioHotstar
dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
content: The rollout includes two-way integration that surfaces streaming links directly inside ChatGPT.
contentSnippet: The rollout includes two-way integration that surfaces streaming links directly inside ChatGPT.

title: (No AI) The speech police came for Colbert
author: David Pierce
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/VRG_VST_021926_Site.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Generally speaking, arcane and mostly unenforced FCC rules are not the province of late night talk shows. FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr seems intent on changing that, though; not long after causing a ruckus that briefly [took Jimmy Kimmel off the air](https://www.theverge.com/news/780471/disney-abc-jimmy-kimmel-live-charlie-kirk), his vague threats appear to have been enough to convince CBS to [tell Stephen Colbert not to air an interview](https://www.theverge.com/policy/880009/stephen-colbert-cbs-fcc-brendan-carr-talarico-interview). Which, of course, became a whole thing.

![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2025/11/Vergecast-Tile-Large.jpeg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

_Verge_ subscribers, don't forget you get exclusive access to ad-free _Vergecast_ wherever you get your podcasts. Head [here](https://www.theverge.com/account/podcasts). Not a subscriber? You can [sign up here](https://www.theverge.com/subscribe).

On [this episode of _The Vergecast_](https://pod.link/vergecast) (which we recorded and published a day early bot …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/podcast/881222/fcc-colbert-talarico-brendan-carr-vergecast)

title: (No AI) Money no longer matters to AI’s top talent
author: Nilay Patel
content:
![A photo illustration featuring Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/DCD_0219.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Today on _Decoder_ we’re going to talk about the war for AI talent. Right now, the hottest job market on the planet is for AI researchers.

The vast majority of these people are concentrated into a small number of hugely valuable, extremely fast-growing companies in the San Francisco Bay Area. Nowadays, such companies are paying some of the highest salaries in the history of the tech industry to poach researchers from one another.

It feels like every time one of these AI researchers leaves one company for another, they tell us exactly why. Sometimes they’re simply [resigning to go be a poet](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c62dlvdq3e3o). Sometimes they’re chasing a mission. Sometimes they’re worried that AI is going to imperil humanity, destroy all jobs, and plunge the world into chaos.

![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/chorus/uploads/chorus_asset/file/24792604/The_Verge_Decoder_Tileart.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

_Verge_ subscribers, don’t forget you get exclusive access to ad-free _Decoder_ wherever you get your podcasts. Head [here](https://www.theverge.com/account/podcasts). Not a subscriber? You can [sign up here](https://www.theverge.com/subscribe).

They’re really saying these things. They’re publishing these notes on X, in blog posts, or in the case of one former OpenAI safety researcher by writing a [full _New York Times_ op-ed](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/11/opinion/openai-ads-chatgpt.html).

I’ve been dying to really dig in and try to unpack what’s going on with all these talent moves in AI. So my guest today is _Verge_ senior AI reporter Hayden Field, who’s been covering the revolving door of the AI industry really closely and also the broader culture that’s motivating the AI workers to jump ship and the companies that are ruthlessly trying to hire them.

Those motivations vary. Sure, all these people are paid extravagant salaries, but as you’ll hear Hayden say, a stronger motivating force is ideology and mission. The people working on AI, by and large, believe that what they’re doing is going to radically change the world, and they’re not really in desperate need of more money. So that really changes the incentive structures that might push people to leave, say, OpenAI for Anthropic, or to [quit Elon Musk’s xAI](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/878761/mass-exodus-at-xai-grok-elon-musk-restructuring) now that it’s been acquired by SpaceX.

At the same time, the incentives of the AI companies themselves are going from raising money to making money. Reporting suggests OpenAI and maybe even Anthropic [could go public this year,](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/openai-ipo-anthropic-race-69f06a42) and doing so would create a historic amount of wealth. It would also put new kinds of pressure on these companies to be more transparent about how they spend money and to be much more accountable for returning on the huge investments that they’ve raised so far.

There’s a lot in this conversation. The AI industry right now is full of drama. There’s big characters, bitter rivalries, lots of money, and really, really long blog posts about the end of the world.

_If you’d like to read more about what we discussed in this episode, check out these links:_

*   What’s behind the mass exodus at xAI? | [_The Verge_](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/878761/mass-exodus-at-xai-grok-elon-musk-restructuring)
*   OpenClaw founder Peter Steinberger is joining OpenAI | [_The Verge_](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/879623/openclaw-founder-peter-steinberger-joins-openai)
*   Two more xAI co-founders leave after the SpaceX merger | [_The Verge_](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/877609/two-more-xai-co-founders-are-among-those-leaving-after-the-spacex-merger)
*   AI safety leader says ‘world is in peril’ and quits to study poetry | [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c62dlvdq3e3o)
*   OpenAI is making the mistakes Facebook made. I quit. | [_The New York Times_](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/11/opinion/openai-ads-chatgpt.html)
*   Anthropic’s chief on AI: ‘We don’t know if the models are conscious’ | [_The New York Times_](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/12/opinion/artificial-intelligence-anthropic-amodei.html)
*   Meet the one woman Anthropic trusts to teach AI morals | [_The Wall Street Journal_](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/anthropic-amanda-askell-philosopher-ai-3c031883?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=AWEtsqfXBfeXgO6fBo8JzOvVyIAMRD4uJgMSTYfUJ7_V36uoSk3m261FNmUyni-zh-A%3D&gaa_ts=699495e0&gaa_sig=c_fHBU1lpTV-fL9dy8w6OOyhM8T1v43D-KngyDMAwuvaO5My3Iqnuq733uDOnmUFikrex1LBLElsbS0wXaUZqw%3D%3D)
*   OpenAI plans fourth-quarter IPO in race to beat Anthropic to market | [_The Wall Street Journal_](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/openai-ipo-anthropic-race-69f06a42)

_Questions or comments about this episode? Hit us up at decoder@theverge.com. We really do read every email!_

Sometimes they’re worried that AI is going to imperil humanity, destroy all jobs, and plunge the world into chaos.

title: (No AI) Introducing OpenAI for India
content: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.
contentSnippet: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.

title: (No AI) GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
content: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.
contentSnippet: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.

title: (No AI) Gemini 3.1 Pro: A smarter model for your most complex tasks
content: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.
contentSnippet: 3.1 Pro is designed for tasks where a simple answer isn’t enough.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music
content: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.
contentSnippet: The Gemini app now features our most advanced music generation model Lyria 3, empowering anyone to make 30-second tracks using text or images.

creator: Justin Pot
title: (No AI) This AI Tool Will Tell You to Stop Slacking Off
dc:creator: Justin Pot
content: Fomi watches you work, then scolds you when your attention wanders. It’s helpful, but there are privacy issues to consider.
contentSnippet: Fomi watches you work, then scolds you when your attention wanders. It’s helpful, but there are privacy issues to consider.

creator: Will Knight
title: (No AI) This Defense Company Made AI Agents That Blow Things Up
dc:creator: Will Knight
content: Scout AI is using technology borrowed from the AI industry to power lethal weapons—and recently demonstrated its explosive potential.
contentSnippet: Scout AI is using technology borrowed from the AI industry to power lethal weapons—and recently demonstrated its explosive potential.
